metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9147 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
named in ISC BIND 9.9.9-P4, 9.9.9-S6, 9.10.4-P4, and 9.11.0-P1 allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and daemonexit) via a response containing an inconsistency among the DNSSEC-relatedRRsets.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9147` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.11
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.11
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.11
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.11
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.11
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.11
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.11
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.11
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.11
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.11
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.11
lwresd - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bind9 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.11').
